newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish FinMin says EMU link still open question.
newsitem.headline: Swedish FinMin says EMU link still open question.

text.p: Sweden's Finance Minister Erik Asbrink said on Friday that Swedish participation in Europe's Economic and Monetary Union (EMU) was still an open question.
"I have not said no to EMU, I have said it's an open question," Asbrink told reporters after a European Union committee meeting.

He said Sweden understood the demands of various automatic checks or fines to ensure EMU members continued to meet stability requirements, but said Sweden was not entirely in agreement with them. "We oppose a high degree of automatic and large fines but have not entirely discarded them," he said.
Asbrink said he was not concerned that Sweden would, in the case of EMU participation, be hit hard by such sanctions.
"Sweden will meet ambitious budget goals as well," he said.
